hints_html: On what range is \(\cos(x)\) positive and negative?
hints_latex: On what range is $\cos(x)$ positive and negative?
hints_raw: On what range is <math>\cos(x)</math> positive and negative?
question: 1 (b)
sols_html:
\(\int_0^\pi |\cos{x}|dx=\int_0^{\pi/2} |\cos{x}|dx+\int_{\pi/2}^\pi |\cos{x}|dx\)

Remember that cos is positive on \([0,\pi/2]\) and negative on \([\pi/2,\pi]\) so

\[\begin{aligned} \int_0^{\pi/2} |\cos{x}|dx+\int_{\pi/2}^\pi |\cos{x}|dx&=\int_0^{\pi/2}\cos{x}dx+\int_{\pi/2}^\pi -\cos{x}dx\\ &=\sin(x)|_0^{\pi/2}-\sin(x)|_{\pi/2}^{\pi}\\ &=\sin(\pi/2)-\sin{(0)}-(\sin(\pi)-\sin(\pi/2))\\ &=1-0-(0-1)=2\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
$\int_0^\pi |\cos{x}|dx=\int_0^{\pi/2} |\cos{x}|dx+\int_{\pi/2}^\pi |\cos{x}|dx$

Remember that cos is positive on $[0,\pi/2]$ and negative on

\begin{align*}
\int_0^{\pi/2} |\cos{x}|dx+\int_{\pi/2}^\pi |\cos{x}|dx&=\int_0^{\pi/2}\cos{x}dx+\int_{\pi/2}^\pi -\cos{x}dx\\
&=\sin(x)|_0^{\pi/2}-\sin(x)|_{\pi/2}^{\pi}\\
&=\sin(\pi/2)-\sin{(0)}-(\sin(\pi)-\sin(\pi/2))\\
&=1-0-(0-1)=2
\end{align*}
